item.title: Metals Set to Finish the Week Higher Despite Mixed Demand Signals, Strong Dollar
item.description: Base metal prices are set to finish the week higher, despite mixed demand signals from Asia and a strong dollar acting as headwinds.

item.title: Sanofi Plans to Spin Off Consumer-Healthcare, Pharma Businesses
item.description: The move makes Sanofi the latest drugmaker to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

item.title: Reckitt Benckiser's Lack of Catalysts Prompts Downgrades
item.description: NatWest’s consensus earnings expectations likely imply double-digit earnings downgrades to 2024 alongside a weaker capital outlook, according to Barclays.

item.title: Oil Gains as Middle East Tensions Rise
item.description: Oil gained more than 1% as tensions in the Middle East continued to worry investors, with BMI predicting prices will trade $80-$95 a barrel over the remainder of 2023 and in early 2024.

item.title: Dollar May Start to React Less to US Data, More to Data Elsewhere
item.description: The dollar’s reaction to the stronger-than-expected U.S. GDP data was “quite muted” and it could, along with other currencies, start to react more to data outside of the U.S., such as the eurozone and China, than it has in recent weeks, ING said.

item.title: NatWest Shares Slide After Profit Outlook Cut
item.description: NatWest shares hit their lowest price since early 2021 after the bank cut its full-year net interest margin guidance and reported below-forecast profits in the third quarter.

item.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Stall Awaiting New Driver
item.description: Eurozone government bonds were little changed and Abrdn said recessionary economic data would suggest lower yields, but selloffs in Treasurys have added upside pressure.

item.title: IAG Confident on Outlook After Strong Third Quarter
item.description: British Airways-owner IAG reported an above-forecast rise in third-quarter core profit, driven by strong leisure demand across all group airlines, and said it expected a solid recovery in 2023 with capacity nearing prepandemic levels.

item.title: Eni Upgrades Outlook After Third-Quarter Beat
item.description: Eni raised its full-year forecasts for operating profit and cash flow after third-quarter results topped analysts’ expectations, boosted by the exploration and production division.

item.title: Remy Cointreau Slashes Guidance After Sales Slump
item.description: Remy Cointreau forecast a 15%-20% decline in organic sales for fiscal 2024, saying market conditions had deteriorated in the U.S., citing a fiercely promotional environment and high interest rates that cut distributors’ financing capacity.

item.title: CaixaBank Profit Boosted by Higher Lending Income
item.description: CaixaBank reported a 19% rise in third-quarter profit on higher lending income and despite a decline in its loans portfolio.

item.title: Covestro Trims Guidance Range
item.description: Covestro lowered its full-year forecasts for underlying earnings and cash flow, citing a challenging environment that weighed on its third-quarter results.

item.title: Watch: Chinese Jet Fighter Intercepts U.S. B-52 Over South China Sea
item.description: Footage released by the U.S. Indo-Pacific Command shows a Chinese jet fighter flying within 10 feet of an American B-52 aircraft at high speed over the South China Sea.

item.title: Air France-KLM Results Fall Short Despite Strong Summer
item.description: Air France-KLM said strong demand for air travel during the summer pushed revenue and profit higher in the third quarter, but not enough to meet forecasts as the group grapples with lingering inflation and high fuel prices.

item.title: Gaza Hospitals, Shelters Cut Back on Services as Fuel Runs Short
item.description: Israeli officials say Hamas has enough fuel but isn’t distributing it to Palestinian civilians.

item.title: J&T Global Shares Fall in Trading Debut
item.description: Shares of Tencent-backed J&T Global Express edged lower early in their Hong Kong trading debut, coming after the Chinese logistics company raised US$501 million in an initial public offering.

item.title: Authorities searched for an Army reservist wanted in connection with the U.S.'s deadliest mass shooting this year, a rampage that sent shock waves through Maine and left part of the state on lockdown.
item.description: Authorities searched for an Army reservist wanted in connection with the U.S.’s deadliest mass shooting this year, a rampage that sent shock waves through Maine and left part of the state on lockdown.

item.title: The ECB followed the Fed in holding rates steady, ending a historic run of 10 consecutive rate increases.
item.description: The ECB followed the Fed in holding rates steady, ending a historic run of 10 consecutive rate increases.

item.title: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried testified that he relied on the blessing of lawyers to make business decisions that prosecutors said allowed him to commit the crimes that led to the implosion of his crypto exchange.
item.description: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried testified that he relied on the blessing of lawyers to make business decisions that prosecutors said allowed him to commit the crimes that led to the implosion of his crypto exchange.

item.title: Amazon.com said profit tripled to nearly $10 billion from July to September because of strong sales in its cloud-computing, advertising and retail units.
item.description: Amazon.com said profit tripled to nearly $10 billion from July to September because of strong sales in its cloud-computing, advertising and retail units.
